review_text:
We had the opportunity to stay here during a two day spell, and while we had some issues during our stay, we would confidently stay here again.
Location is great - Little Havana has so much to offer, and my wife and I felt like this place was a great access point to great food and cultureâ€¦we even got to meet the neighborhood cat and chickens!
We had an issue with the AC, as we originally were not able to change the temperature. With a quick note to our host and a switch of some batteries, we were able to figure it out.
We also had an issue with the bathroom: the lights didnâ€™t work, and the light fixture fell and shattered, but with a quick message to Johanna, she immediately offered to refund part of our stay.
All in all, we were provided excellent customer service, and while we had issues, Johanna made it whole and was extremely responsive throughout our stay. Would definitely recommend staying here.

We did not have a good experience here unfortunately.

review_text: The listing is as described and is a tidy, compact studio a few blocks away from Calle Ocho in Little Havana. Itâ€™s the ideal size for a solo traveler but might be a bit cramped for two (my friend stayed the second night on the futon during a two night stay on our way to a trip overseas). The unit is stocked with essentials (cutlery, linens, etc), but also thoughtful extras (aloe gel, condiments etc) which comes in handy. During our stay, we had a bit of trouble with the digital key entry and it ended up locking us out, but Johanna replied back almost instantaneously and told us how to access an emergency key box located right by the door. She was very responsive throughout the whole booking process and stay. The neighborhood is in Little Havana so we did hear some wild roosters crowing about (theyâ€™re a hallmark of the area), but we both had earplugs and this wasnâ€™t really an issue for us. The unit is just close enough to Calle Ocho to be convenient but far enough to not be disruptive.

I stayed here for 1.5 months and can say this is one of the best Airbnb experiences Iâ€™ve had.
Hostess - The hostess is amazing. She always responded very quickly and went out of her way to ensure I was comfortable and had everything I needed.
Location - Itâ€™s a 5 minute walk from the exciting Calle Ocho and a 10 minute drive from Brickell City Centre. 15 minute drive to South Beach and Wynwood. Itâ€™s close to everything. Also about 15 minutes to the nearest beach and the Miami airport.
Safety - the neighborhood is very quiet and I felt safe walking around solo both day and night. I even had some mail delivered there with no issues. You may hear some roosters though!
Studio - The place was very clean, comfortable, and overall practical. I was even able to extend the table to fit my 3 computers so I could work remotely.
This is the best bang for buck spot youâ€™ll get!

review_text:
Wonderful stay at a luxury property for much less than a hotel room would be. The condo was extremely clean, and exactly as described/pictured. The bed was very comfortable and there were tons of extra pillows and towels, plus plenty of dishes/kitchen ware, etc. Having a washer/dryer in the unit was very convenient (although the dryer took a many cycles to actually dry the clothes, so donâ€™t wash anything right before leaving!). The private furnished balcony really set this unit apart from other similar Airbnbs in this neighborhood, and the view was really awesome. You will have to restock coffee pods/TP etc if youâ€™re staying more than a couple days, but there is a 24-hour Walgreens right across the street.
Very smooth check-in and check-out process, very communicative host, and you really do get full access to the entire resort (all the pools and the beach amenities). It was pricey, but we definitely donâ€™t regret it!

This stay was in a really lovely, quiet location and so close to the beach. They were very accommodating and allowed us to drop off our luggage early and leave it with them while waiting for our flight. They also offered a late check out which was great. Room was comfortable - comfortable temperature - nice large tvs - just a cute stay with some nice stylish touches. The only thing to make it absolutely perfect would be to have someone on site at all times but truly not a complaint and just a suggestion! Additionally - they left beach chairs for us in our room upon arrival which was super generous. Overall great stay and worth the price. Would stay here again.
It is also quite close to Cafe Sazon which we were obsessed with. Walk here if you can before hitting the beach!
If youâ€™re looking for a relaxed beach stay where you can grab food and drinks and sit at the beach in peace and quiet this is the place. Thank you for a great stay!!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Absolutely amazing place if you look for something peaceful in Miami Beach but at the same time not far from everything.
The location is very convenient - the beach is just two blocks away, very clean beach and water, plenty of space, very nice boardwalk, volleyball terrains on the beach. All the amenities are also very close - many stores , restaurants, coffee shops etc. There is trolley stop that could be used to go to the South Beach. For those with car - the nearby street parking is free, but on first come first serve basis, so on weekends the spots are almost always occupied, but on weekdays - there is no issue to park. In any case -quite nearby there is a huge outdoor municipal parking lot that does not cost a lot and sometimes is free.
The apartment itself if very clean and convenient. We had two rooms, with the one which is purely for sleeping and another as a hybrid bedroom/living room. Bathroom is convenient as well and air conditioning is powerful and not noisy. I recommend

review_text:
This place a cute stay for my fiancÃ© and I! It was 3-4 blocks from the beach which was awesome! However, the space would be a bit tight for more than 2 people. It also was very loud at night. You could easily hear the neighbors.
The air bnb photos were not very accurate. The air bnb I thought we booked had a separate room with a bed in it; however, the space we got had the bed right as you walked into the front door. No separation from the kitchen and the bed room. Very limited utensils/kitchen supplies in the unit though. Could use a scissors, useable knives, garbage bags, more towels, etc.
Overall, made a great little stay for a couple nights though! The space was nice, clean, and cute!

review_text:
Pros:
- The area was very safe and quiet
- Walking distance to plenty of food and to the beach
- Two TVs in the AirBnB
- Bed was comfy and air conditioning worked well
- The host is super friendly, nice and communicates well. He is near the property if you ever need anything
Cons:
- Parking is awful, you need to get lucky to get parking (or there is a parking lot about a block away but youâ€™ll need to pay like $5 to park car overnight)
- The host will charge $15 for extra towels
Overall:
This a nice place to stay, especially for the price. Parking and the extra towels fee are annoying but the AirBnB is still a nice place to stay, especially if youâ€™re downing most of your time on the beach or out exploring and just need a place to sleep for the night.

Maybe the best airbnb host Iâ€™ve ever stayed with. Everything was as pictured and the place was spotless. Situated 2 blocks off of Collins in a quiet residential area, it was quiet and peaceful yet close to all of the action. Great restaurants, bars, and a beautiful beach within walking distance. Cachito Coffee and Bakery, Burgers and Shakes, and El Grande Rancho were my favorites nearby. 15-20 min Uber to South Beach, Brickell, etc.
The best part about this booking was meeting the property manager Mr. Ernesto. He was kind and very polite and made us feel safe and welcomed. We will definitely book again on our next trip to Miami Beach!

review_text: We truly enjoyed staying here! Ernesto was very proactive in communicating with us the day before and after check-in, and was so very friendly and helpful! The place was in a very quiet neighborhood and close to lots of great restaurants and only 2 blocks to the beach. We spent the week walking and biking to mid-beach and to south beach from this location with no problems at all. We had our coffee and breakfast at Sazon and the Argentine bakery across the street daily, and had several of our dinners within walking distance as well. This really was the perfect location for us, and we would highly recommend. The unit was clean, with plenty of supplies. The bed was comfortable and we had everything we needed. The unit was behind a security gate in the courtyard which made us feel extra secure. Thank you so much to our host Ernesto, we will be back for sure!

review_text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in Miami! Max was super responsive and handled any need I had during my stay. The condo is spotless, comfy and mirrors the pictures. The floor-to-ceiling windows provide a spectacular view and abundant natural light. Check-in and parking details are concise and require several steps to officially check-in. Thereâ€™s an active construction site right next to the building that you can see and hear from the condo. Work begins early in the morning (before 7 am) through the evening. The noise didnâ€™t bother my family, but it does obstruct the views and can impact the â€œvibesâ€ of your stay and sleep. The area is walkable, with various places to eat and socialize. Miami Beach and Wynwood are 30-40 minutes away. Thereâ€™s a tasty vegan restaurant across the street (in the Connect Four building) thatâ€™s open late called The Cocinita. Overall, it was a wonderful and worthwhile stay! Go ahead and book it!

review_text:
We had an amazing time in Miami thanks to Max and his beautiful, centrally located home in Brickell. Max was incredibly responsive, and ensured my group of friends was safe, and had plenty of amenities and recommendations to choose from. The apartment itself is sizable. For each person to have their own bed, the max would be 4, but we were 5 and slept comfortably. One thing I will say is that there is a bit of construction that makes it noisy outside, but that can easily be solved with some earplugs.
A huge plus is that we were just a short drive to Miami Beach, and to all the major hot spots.
All in all, we had the best time, much in part due to Max and all of his help!

name: Rachel
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
November 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This AirBnB was in a secure and private location which made us feel safe and at ease. We used Uber Eats quite a bit and it was easy for them to find the place. Hot tip: make sure your Uber drivers pick you up on Frow, not McDonald :)
The layout and decor of the space was great, the bed was very comfortable and cozy (great pillows). The shower was awesome though the bathroom can get steamy as there is no vent and windows don't open (it's a Florida thing, to avoid mold growth in the HVAC). The AC worked perfectly. We loved having a free washer/dryer because we could go home with clean clothes (tip: bring your own detergent pods or plan to buy a bag at the CVS, a five minute walk from the AirBnB).
Small suggestions: include ground coffee/coffee filters for the coffee machine & provide at least salt and pepper and hot sauce. On the other hand, this very sweet host provided eggs, milk, cereal, and a couple canned Starbucks!! Would DEFINITELY stay here again if in Miami!!!

The location is perfect - tons of restaurants, bars, and shops in walking distance (the Grove has changed a lot since I grew up but I welcome a lot of the new additions). We were grateful that the Airbnb was gated with a parking spot, and we were pleasantly surprised how quiet the nights were despite how close we were to the heart of the Grove. Carlos and his assistants were extremely responsive and proactive at offering services such as RoomBox (we didnâ€™t take advantage of what they had to offer but it was nice to have the option). Also, it was awesome to have access to a washer/dryer as well. We would absolutely stay here again!

Really, overall the house and hosts were great. We especially enjoyed the pool and backyard and quiet street. Pool was my highlight.
Our challenge was we didnâ€™t realize that the two main bedrooms would be so small. Pretty & comfortable but no room to hang in.
The description was not misleading but we assumed there would be a way to watch in bed like our previous rentals. So if u wanna chill and watch you would need to go to the main room and sit on the pink arm chairs or on the blue couch.
This house is best for teens and couples.
Not ideal for children. No bedroom space for a crib and no bathtub.
The 3rd bedroom (suite) is not attached to main house. Different entranceâ€¦ so again works for teens or a couple, but not safe for children.
Summary, if you donâ€™t watch in bed, and if you donâ€™t use a tub, and are happy to hang out in main room, this house is perfect!

name: Susan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The house was impeccably clean and pretty comfortable. The pool and garden are outstanding - beautiful landscaping and a nice large covered area to get out of the sun/rain. We loved the outdoor shower too. One thing that surprised us was the third bedroom and second bath are not connected to the rest of the house - you have to go outside and around to the side of the house to a separate entrance to access them. This didn't cause problems for us, but might for others. Another surprise was that the kitchen countertops are all covered with a clear plastic sheeting to protect them, which we found really unattractive and kind of a pain to work on. The kitchen is moderately well-stocked with pots & pans, etc. The location of the house is not particularly convenient to anything, unfortunately. We were surprised what a project it was to get to a beach - more than once sitting in traffic for 40 minutes to get across the causeway. But if you just want to relax around the pool, this is a great choice!

review_text: Richard And Joseâ€™s house is an absolute gem. They are kind and responsive hosts; the house is beautifully designed and very comfortable; and the backyard is just stunning. The covered patio, the fully fenced yard with beautiful tropical plantings, the saltwater pool, the outdoor showerâ€”we loved spending time in this secluded and peaceful outdoor haven, soaking up the sun. The energy of the whole place is very restful and restorative. Also, I know Miami well and I appreciated the location: itâ€™s a quiet street, with friendly neighbors, but youâ€™re a very short and easy drive from culinary and cultural destinations in Wynwood, Little River, Design District, etc. Perfect if you want to be close to a lot of activity but also want to avoid dealing with a lot of city noise and tricky parking. My husband and I have stayed in many different AirBnBs around the world and this is one of the absolute best. I canâ€™t recommend Richard And Joseâ€™s place highly enough.

Second, there was other peopleâ€™s hair on the showers. You can notice the showers havenâ€™t been scrubbed. There was mold under the shower mat as well. Third was the sheets and pillow cases have stains on them, very visible yellow stains. There is mold under the sink and everywhere. The space is much smaller than expected. We had a big cockroach in the room which then makes you question is there more roaches anywhere else and makes the stay uneasy. This is not at all like the pictures. The seller did have great communication overall but since I left there has been no further communication on how to resolve this.

February 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Donâ€™t be fooled by the overly edited photos and low pricing. This place was horrible. Dirty lobby and stairs, no elevator, sketchy neighborhood, and super thin walls. Sleeping here feels like youâ€™re in a parking lot next to a highway and train tracks, because you are. The windows and walls are so thin that they might as well be open air. You can hear people in neighboring rooms and CONSTANT traffic, horns, and motorcycles outside. The bathrooms were also old and dirty with stained floors and room smelled musty. I left after the first night of no sleep and booked a vacation rental. Before I checked out, the management agreed to give me a refund then changed their mind after leading me on for 11 days that they were â€œprocessingâ€ it. This was the worst hotel experience Iâ€™ve ever had in Miami and Iâ€™ve been traveling there for ten years. Make sure to check the online reviews for Treehouse Studio Hotel before booking and youâ€™ll see what I mean. Mostly 1-2 star ratings. Avoid at all costs.

Not worth the money, could find better options for this price, as well as an accurate description. The location was pretty good. Bianca was very good at commentating and helpful when we needed her, the was the plus side! Side note: they are also offering future discounts at the end of your stay if you leave them a 5 star review, which could be why their reviews are so high.

name: Joseph
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Check in was extremely easy. The room was just like the photos, clean and plenty of space. Everything you need for a quick stay. There isn't a front desk employee but they are extremely responsive over the Airbnb chat. Didn't have any issues during the stay, everything in my room was fine. The hallways smell a bit musty but it's an old building so that's kind of expected. The AC in my room was great, very cold and you can easily adjust with a remote. Bed was comfortable. The location itself isn't in a tourist hotspot but you're a 10-15 minute drive to busy areas. You can hear a lot of traffic driving by during the daytime. Obviously less noise at night but keep in mind the walls are thin (it's an old building). Don't expect a high end hotel here but it's a good value for your money in Miami.

Its not exactly a boutique hotel as described more like a 3 star motel. The rooms have a fridge and microwave but nothing else like any cutlery or cups and not provided on request either.

name: Volker & Chandra
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
November 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Bianca was a very responsive host, good communication. This is a 3 story building with 8 rooms on each floor. Our room was located on the 3rd floor towards the main street. Here are the pros & cons you need to be aware off:
Pros:
- Silent mini-split air conditioning in room (negated by noise level coming in from street)
- located close to bus stop for using public transport
- spacious room
Cons:
- No elevator, lugging 2x50 pound suitcases up two floors might not be for everyone
- Single pane windows let all the street noise in unfiltered, it is like sleeping next to the road.
- Bare bones: 2xbath towels, no hand towels or wash cloth, no cutlery, plates, cups or any other kind of dishes, so if you want to use the provided microwave you need to bring your own
- "window" in bathroom was a piece of glass without frame, meaning it could not be opened.
- Carpet on staircase very stained/worn down.
- you are being asked to dump your trash in yard container, despite $69 cleaning fee

rating_info:

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was a lovely place to stay for a few days. We enjoyed being there from the beginning, but as we got around and saw more of Miami (and Florida) we realized how special it was. A couple of things to be mindful of: getting in through the gate is a bit tricky the first couple of times because it faces the corner of a busy street. You can hear the traffic from the pool area. The kitchen is on the dark side. But the pluses are many. Despite the previously mentioned noise, we loved being by the pool. The setting is very tranquil. Was nice for swimming, too. The vegetation is tropical, attractive, and sheltering. There are a couple of beautiful cats in residence--friendly ones that like being petted. It's an easy drive from the place to Calle Ocho, and there's a Publix grocery story a few minutes' drive in the other direction (part of a fancy, multistory complex overlooking a canal full of yachts). You can walk one block to a Walgreens, if you need a quart of milk.

I reached out and husband came, realized that the infinity app wasn't downloaded on it, offered to get it sorted it and I told him then and there that it was ok. He insisted and I said it's not necessary I'll hardly be indoors. He left and messaged that he'd come to fix it and I never responded giving permission to. When I returned later that night, the app was loaded. I said nothing. The next day I saw the wife and I told her that the wifi signal was poor. She said she knew router was broken and a new one was coming in that day. I said ok. Later that day she texted that problem was fixed. I asked if they entered without my permission because it was not necessary. She downplayed it but router in the unit was missing when I returned.

We loved our stay at this perfect little guest house!
The location is superb for getting around Miami, with plenty of local restaurants and essentials within walking distance. We drove from Orlando and found the place very easily and felt extremely comfortable that our hire car was safely parked in the gated property! For those unsure of tourists reviews on a location, we were visiting friends that live in Miami and they agreed that it was a superb location and a safe neighbourhood!
The guest house itself has everything you would need and is far superior and much more affordable than any hotel you would find in the city! Unfortunately we just didnâ€™t have time to use the pool or spa as we were too busy during our stay but the area itself was lovely and even just sitting in our garden felt like an escape from the hustle and bustle! A special mention should be made for how comfortable the bed was!
Deborahâ€™s communication was superb from the moment of booking and her recommendations were fantastic - especially the Ball and Chain bar! Check in was simple and whilst we didnâ€™t need anything we felt confident knowing that we could ask anything whether it be advice or an additional request.
We would highly recommend this stay and wouldnâ€™t hesitate to return on our next visit to Miami!

Overall a good stay.
Proâ€™s:
+ Clean room with a cafe right on the premises.
+ Host was attentive and friendly and stayed in touch with us via the app.
+ AC/ heater worked well.
+ Modern decor with everything well placed.
+ Mini fridge and safe in room
Conâ€™s
- No deadbolt or safety lock on the door to prevent anyone else with the code from entering.
- Entry door gets stuck halfway open and bathroom door struggles to close.
- Shower door leaks water out onto the floor.
- No ice machine anywhere on the premises.
- Tv remote had issues with volume controls not working half of the time. We literally had to unplug the tv twice to get them to work again.
Still a good value but hope to see some repairs in the future.

Our stay at this Airbnb met our expectations, offering the convenience and comfort typically found in a hotel room. We felt safe throughout our stay, which was a major plus. One of the highlights was definitely the rooftop area, where we enjoyed great views of Miami. It provided a perfect spot for relaxation and taking in the scenery.
The location was good â€“ nestled in a relatively peaceful part of mid-beach, while still granting easy access to the vibrant South Beach area, which is just a short stroll or Uber ride away. Additionally, the beach was incredibly close, requiring no more than a 5-minute walk to reach the sand. This made our beach outings effortless and frequent.
Overall, our stay was great, thanks to the excellent location and responsive hosts.

review_text:
At Mine was a perfect stay for our short 3 night trip to Miami. All the listed amenities were provided and whenever we needed extra towels before heading to the beach, we were free to help ourselves.
The hosts were very friendly, communicative, and proactive in making sure we had everything we needed (special shoutout to Bianca who assisted us throughout our stay).
The place is located in the Mid-Beach area so it is far enough away from the chaos of the South Beach area but close enough to get to popular restaurants and bars. There are convenient cafes nearby and Bon Bouquet Cafe is located in the lobby of the building (it just launched on the day we were leaving so we didn't get a chance to try it but it is super convenient for anyone staying here for a quick breakfast/brunch). While there is no direct beach access connected to the property, the beach is easily accessible right across the street. Overall it was a great stay and highly recommended!

name: Mitesh
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
December 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Pros:
- Just 2 min walking distance to bus which will take you to downtown Miami in 30 minutes
- Responsive host. Easy check-in and check-out
- Great neighborhood close to many restaurants and shops
- Proximity to Miami Beach
Cons:
- Small apartment for 2 people. Not viable if there are 2 people with one more kid.
- Biggest problem being walls are not soundproof. One can hear neighbors talking even at regular conversations. For all 4 nights I spent, the neighbors angrily banged the wall and even screamed at us even though we were talking at regular voice level. This was very unsafe. Not suitable for family.
- I stayed for 4 nights, if we request for cleaning, then there is an extra $30 fee per cleaning. The billed $69 cleaning fee is only for one-time before check-in. So itâ€™s a problem for longer stays where we need to pay extra for cleaning.
- Not enough towels and soaps provided in the room. Need to explicitly request for it. But yes, they did provided quickly on request.

Stayed over a week
review_text: Great value! I stayed at the Venezia for 22-days and it was a good experience. I would highly recommend them for extended stays of experienced travelers. The value is really great and I felt like they went they extra mile to check in and make sure everything was OK with my stay. The rooftop lounge is a hidden gem and an amenity I came to appreciate a lot more over time. The rooms are comparable to a 3-3.5 star hotel (similiar to a Cambria). The location is perfect. The Venezia ultimately checked a lot more boxes than I expected when I booked my stay - book with confidence. The one critical thing I would mention is if you have sensitive allergies you might want to test out the viability of your stay first as this building is an older building (with a quality face lift) on the canal.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My best friend and I had a great time during our stay. Check-in was flexible (we ultimately arrived earlier than anticipated) and the host was responsive. When we got to our room, we noticed something that did not meet our expectations, and after we brought it to the attention of management, we were able to quickly change rooms and even had an upgraded room. Everyday the host checked in on us in the morning to see if we needed anything which was so nice and helpful. We were also able to get fresh towels easily. The location is great because there is a cafe/convenience store nearby if you need anything and Ubers/Lyfts are affordable. Also during our stay there were contractors looking to make improvements so the building has nice amenities and upgrades. Our bed was also super comfortable. Would recommend for anyone looking for an affordable place for a quick getaway in Miami!
